Ciudad Guayana is the collective name given to two adjacent towns,
, that have sprawled and merged into one city. The city's economy is based on heavy industry, inlcuding huge aluminum and steel export plants.

value: - Hydroelectricity provides some two thirds of Venezuela's energy needs, most of which comes from Guri. You can take a tour round the facilities.

The city has a Brazilian consul, on the way down to the
. This is the second last place before reaching the border where you can ask for a Brazilian visa (necessary for US, Canada, ...). The last place is at
, 12 km from the border. Getting the visa takes usually 1-3 days.
